The course went into great detail about how the C++ language works and Object Oriented programming in general  with excellent examples.

While I appreciated the code-examples-as-the-presentation, when I missed a class, I found it difficult to figure out exactly what was discussed that day in class, especially missing subtleties. This is a minor quibble, but it would be helpful if you wrote a few sentences about what you discussed in class each code-example/notes.

Strengths: course content and assignments are perfect
Weakness: the in-class code is not as systematic as normal notes. Sometimes I may lose focus on some points.
very good course, a lot to learn
Yes. The course and the assignments are helpful for programmers to learn C++.

Yes. Glenn explained concept of OOP very clearly, provided with detailed examples. And the workload is not heavy. My programming skill has improved a lot and became much more confident to writing big project.
